definition: to raise or lower the price/price adjustment
to harmonize/to reconcile/to blend/to suit well/to adjust/to regulate/to season (food)/to provoke/to incite
to transfer/to move (troops or cadres)/to investigate/to enquire into/accent/view/argument/key (in music)/mode (music)/tune/tone/melody

sentences.english: And Yuantong Express raised price again during mid Autumn Festival.
sentences.chinese: 今年中秋节前，圆通速运也再次调价。

sentences.english: If it is lower, they then ask for an adjustment.
sentences.chinese: 假如降价了，他们就要求调价。

sentences.english: Subsidies were granted to the fishery industry and four others that were greatly affected by changes in the prices of refined petroleum products.
sentences.chinese: 对受成品油调价影响较大的渔业等五大行业实施补贴。

sentences.english: Akagi last increased prices a quarter of a century ago, and it debated the recent rise for seven or eight years, Mr.
sentences.chinese: 赤城乳业上次调价是在四分之一个世纪以前。

definition: to appreciate (in value)/to increase in price
to cut the price/to drive down the price/to get cheaper
to demote/to pass down to a lower unit
to adjust downwards/to lower (prices, wages etc)
to set a price/to fix a price
(of a price) to fluctuate according to the market/to sell at the market price
wholesale price/to settle an account/to pay a bill
